author: Christoph Guttandin
description: A replacement for setInterval() and setTimeout() which works in unfocused windows.
name: audio-context-timers

scripts.build: rimraf build/* && tsc --project src/tsconfig.json && rollup --config config/rollup/bundle.mjs && babel ./build/es2019 --config-file ./config/babel/build.json --out-dir ./build/node
scripts.lint: npm run lint:config && npm run lint:src && npm run lint:test
scripts.test: npm run lint && npm run build && npm run test:integration-browser && npm run test:integration-node && npm run test:unit
scripts.test:integration-browser: if [ "$TYPE" = "" -o "$TYPE" = "integration" ] && [ "$TARGET" = "" -o "$TARGET" = "chrome" -o "$TARGET" = "firefox" -o "$TARGET" = "safari" ]; then npx vitest --config config/vitest/integration.ts; fi
scripts.test:integration-node: if [ "$TYPE" = "" -o "$TYPE" = "integration" ] && [ "$TARGET" = "" -o "$TARGET" = "node" ]; then npx vitest --browser.enabled false --config config/vitest/integration.ts; fi
scripts.test:unit: if [ "$TYPE" = "" -o "$TYPE" = "unit" ]; then npx vitest --config config/vitest/unit.ts; fi
